p filter: The indoor and vent air filters should be cleaned once per month. Filters that are not cleaned will become clogged and restrict airflow, which can lead to major component damage. If an air filter becomes torn, has holes, or other damage, replace it with a new one.
span filter: “The unit should be cleaned once a year, typically going into the cooling season,” he stated. “And your air filters should be cleaned every 30 days.”
p coil: “We recommend that you pretreat the coil to loosen up dirt and debris before cleaning,” Bench said. A low-pressure washer should be used for coil cleaning. “A high-pressure washer would damage the fins,” he said.
div coil: Carrier senior technician George Hunt cleans a unit's coils.
p maintenance: But users don’t always pay attention to the need for cleaning. “Preventive maintenance is something we’ve been working on very hard for the last couple of years,” said Bench.
span maintenance: Preventive maintenance is essential for efficient operation and long service life from packaged terminal air conditioners (PTACs), as well as packaged terminal heat pumps (PTHPs). That’s the word from Ron Bench of Carrier Corp.
